meanings.definition: The act of attributing or ascribing something to a particular cause or source.
meanings.sent1: Her attribution of the success to teamwork was appreciated by everyone.
meanings.sent2: The attribution of the painting to the famous artist was confirmed by experts.
meanings.sent3: His attribution of the messy room to the dog's cleaning skills made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The attribution of the mysterious noise to ghosts sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The attribution of the delicious smell to the nearby bakery made their mouths water.

meanings.definition: The action of regarding something as being caused by a specified person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The attribution of the broken vase to the cat's playful antics was evident.
meanings.sent2: Her attribution of the beautiful garden to her hard work brought her joy.
meanings.sent3: The attribution of the missing cookies to the cookie monster was a funny excuse.
meanings.sent4: The attribution of the loud music to the party next door kept them awake.
meanings.sent5: The attribution of the amazing cake to her baking skills impressed everyone.

meanings.definition: The assignment of a work or a particular passage to a particular author.
meanings.sent1: The attribution of the famous play to the renowned playwright was well-known.
meanings.sent2: His attribution of the inspiring speech to the guest speaker was accurate.
meanings.sent3: The attribution of the funny joke to the comedian made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The attribution of the emotional song to the talented singer touched many hearts.
meanings.sent5: The attribution of the classic novel to the author's pen name surprised readers.
